nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
## Automatically optimise images uploaded to Google drive folder
Each time an image is added to a google drive folder, this workflow will send it to tinypng.com to optimise the size and resave it to a google drive location of your choice.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
### 1. Pre-setup: Google Drive credentials

**a.** Firstly you'll need to setup Google Drive credentials. Best thing is to [read n8n docs]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} to to do that.
**b.** Once you're successfully connecting to your GDrive account, set all 3 of the Drive nodes to connect using that credential.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
### 2. Choose the Google Drive folder n8n is going to watch for new files

**a.** Go to Google Drive and create the folder you want n8n to watch for new images
**b.** Then you need to select that folder in the Google Drive trigger node

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
### 3. Create an API key for tinypng.com

**a.** Visit [tinypng.com]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} and request an API key
**b.** Update the "Authorisation" parameter value with your api key. It will be in the format of "Basic YOUR_API_KEY_IN_BASE_64"

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
### 4. Choose your Google Drive folder to save your upload your optimised images to

**a.** Finally, create and select the folder that you want your optimised images to be saved to
**b.** OPTIONAL: You can also change the formatting of the name that you set. By default it will use the original file name then -optimised

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Optimise images uploaded to GDrive

## Overview
Automated workflow: Optimise images uploaded to GDrive. This workflow integrates 5 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, googleDriveTrigger, googleDrive, stopAndError. It contains 17 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 17
- **Node Types**: 5
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Check GDrive for new images**: googleDriveTrigger
- **Download image**: googleDrive
- **Optimise - Send image to TinyPNG**: httpRequest
- **Get optimised image from tinyPNG**: httpRequest
- **Sticky Note4**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note3**: stickyNote
- **Google Drive**: googleDrive
- ... and 7 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
